page.title: 05A MIXED FARM IN LYDFORD
page.content: Today we visited a mixed farm called Battishill, half a mile from the village to the West.It is 250 acres and is run by the farmer with one man working part-time.He showed us around the farm. First we saw the sheds where the machinery is kept and where the stock is kept in the Winter.He keeps some bullocks for fattening and some sheep and lambs. He sells the bullocks at Hatherleigh Market,also the lambs.The sheep are shorn in the Spring and he sells the wool. The farmer makes silage and hay to feed the stock and grows Winter and Spring barley for feed.The rest of the fields are used for grazing. We saw the fields of barley and the bullocks and sheep.The sheep need a lot of care with dipping,drenching and tail docking.
